mechanosensation.notes: As sponges, Placospongiidae likely possess mechanosensory capabilities to detect water currents and particle movement for filter feeding. This is inferred from other sponge species.

chemoreception.notes: Sponges rely on chemoreception to detect dissolved organic matter and other chemical cues in the water, influencing their feeding and other physiological processes. This is inferred from other sponge species.

photosensitivity.notes: The presence and role of photosensitivity in Placospongiidae is unknown.
